record.field: 1. What do you think is the purpose of the ITIL?
C. IT spywares and infection diagnosing
2. What is the new acronym for CCTA?
3. Which of these levels will ITIL not address?
A. Central Control of Technology Advancements
B. Central Computer and Telecommunications Agency
5. In which year was the ITIL invented?
6. How many libraries does the initial value version of ITIL consist of?
7. What is type of an entity is ITIL?
8. Which of these is a subset discipline of service delivery?
9. What is the cost analysis of future projects and expenditures to align with finance status?
10. What is the identification of service anomalies and restoration of system functions?
11. Which of the following areas would technology help to support during the Service Transition phase of the lifecycle?

p.b:
1. Data mining and workflow tools
2. Measurement and reporting systems
3. Release and deployment technology
4. Process Design

record.field: 12. Which of the following statements BEST describes a Definitive Media Library (DML)?
A. A secure library where definitive authorised versions of all media Configuration Items(Cls) are stored and protected
B. A secure location where defintive hardware spares are held
C. A database that contains definitions of all media Cls
D. A secure library where definitive authorised versions of all software and back-ups are stored and protected
13. The group that authorizes changes that must be installed faster than the normal process is called the?
14. A change process model should include:

p.b:
1. The steps that should be taken to handle the change with any
dependences or co-processing defined, including handling issues and
unexpexted events
2. Responsibilities; who should do what, including escalation
3. Timescales and thresholds for completion of the actions
4. Complaints procedures

record.field: 15. Which of these would fall outside the scope of a typical service change management process.
A. A firmware upgrade to a server that is only used for IT Service Continuity purposes
B. An urgent need to replace a CPU to restore a service during an incident
C. A change to a contract with supplier
D. A change to a business process that depends on IT Services
16. Which of the following statements is INCORRECT?
A. The SKMS is part of the Configuration Management System (CMS)
B. The SKMS can include data on the performance of the organization
C. The Service Knowledge Management System (SKMS) includes Configuration Management Databases (CMDB)
D. The SKMS can include user skill levels
17. Service Assets are used to create value. Which of the following are the MAJOR types of Service Asset?
18. Effective release and deployment management enables the service provider to add value to the business by?
A. Delivering change, faster and at optimum cost and minimized risk
B. Ensures that the fastest servers are purchased
C. Ensuring that all assets are accounted for
D. Verifying the accuracy of all items in the configuration management database
19. Which of the following BEST describes a Change Authority?
A. A person that provides formal authorisation for a particular type of change
B. A role, person or a group of people that provides formal authorisation for a particular type of change
D. The Change Manager who provides formal authorisation for each change
20. What is the entry point or the first level of the V model?
21. Which of the following activities are helped by recording relationships between Configuration Items (CIs)?

p.b:
1. Assessing the impact and cause of Incidents and
Problems
2. Assessing the impact of proposed Changes
3. Planning and designing a Change to an existing service
4. Planning a technology refresh or software upgrade

record.field: 22. A single Release unit, or a structured set of Release units can be defined within:
A. The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
23. Service Acceptance criteria are used to?
A. Ensure delivery and support of a service
B. Ensure the design stage of the Life Cycle
C. Ensure service Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are reported
D. Ensure Portofolio Management is in place
24. Effective release and deployment management enables the service provider to add value to the business by?
A. Ensuring that all assests are accounted for
B. Delivering change, faster and at optimum cost and minimized risk
C. Ensures that the fastest servers are purchased
D. Ensuring that all assets are accounted for
25. How does Problem Management work with Change Management?
A. By issuing RFCs for permanent solutions
B. By negotiating with Incident Management for changes in IT for Problem resolution
C. By installing changes to fix problems
D. By working with users to change their IT configurations
26. Which practice coordinates the classification, ownership and communication of service requests and incidents?
27. Which ITIL guiding principle recommends using existing services, processes and tools when improving services?
B. Keep is simple and practical
28. Which practice has a purpose that includes ensuring that risks have been properly assessed?
29. When should a full risk assessment and authorization be carried out for a standard change?
A. Each time the standard change is implemented
B. When the procedure for the standard change is created
C. At least once a year
D. When an emergency change is requested
30. Which word is missing from the following sentence? "A logical configuration model records the relationships between Assets, the Infrastructure and ________ "
